article:
'James Lauritz Reveal' (born 1941) is a botanist, professor emeritus at the
Norton Brown Herbarium, Maryland (see his
[http://www.life.umd.edu/emeritus/reveal/pbio/WWW/cvjlr.html cv]).

He is perhaps best known for his work on suprageneric names, presented in an
extensive [http://www.life.umd.edu/emeritus/reveal/pbio/fam/inspvindex.html
website], which also presents material on [http://www.biologie.uni-hamburg.de/b-
online/systems/ plant taxonomy], including several systems of plant taxonomy
(among which the Reveal system). However, he also has published extensively on
the North American flora and he is a member of the Angiosperm Phylogeny Group
(that is, he is a contributing author for APG II).
